intro: Tarachia arguta, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub with succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor itself in sandy soils and access deep water sources. Tarachia arguta plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
